comment._content: William Caldwell Gorgas was Surgeon General & held rid Havana of yellow fever. www.encyclopedia.com/topic/William_Crawford_Gorgas.aspx#1...

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: captainslack and swanq:  Thanks for the info! This is indeed William Crawford Gorgas (1854-1920), honorary degree recipient at Columbia University's June 4, 1913 commencement.  When we update the record, we will expand on the caption to include this information.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: William C. Gorgas was a U. S. Army General, and a military surgeon who introduced mosquito eradication to eliminate Yellow Fever in Havana during the Spanish Amerian War, and later in the Panama Canal Zone, during construction of the canal. history.amedd.army.mil/surgeongenerals/W_Gorgas.html Bain's and LOC's captions to the above photo are incorrect: Gorgas was not a Professor; he wore the academic rig when he received an honorary degree from Columbia. A Bain/LOC photo of Gorgas with Mrs. Gorgas: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4465089768/in/photostream/] Another photo was posed to Flickr on November 12, 2010: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5169600800/]

comment.author: 22848403@N02
comment._content:
What double talented person Mr. William C. Gergas was if your information is correct!  He is that kind of person we can see the intelligence from just seeing his face.  

With ranking as General in Army and work as Military Surgeon.  Wow!

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC: Gorgas was NOT a Professor -- he wore the academic gown at Columbia to receive an honorary degree.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Wystan: Thank you for your comment on this image.  "Prof" is part of the original Bain caption, so we keep this wording as the title, with a note that it comes from  the negative. However,  we will add more information to the catalog record to clarify that he was not a professor.
